t: For the director of music. According to gittith. Of Asaph.
Sing*pn for joy to God our strength; shout*ld aloud to the God of Jacob!
Begin*ln the music, strike the timbrel, play*ld the melodious harp and lyre.
Sound*pn the ram’s horn at the New Moon, and*ld when the moon is full, on the day of our festival;
this*ln is a decree for Israel, an*ld ordinance of the God of Jacob.
When*ln God went out against Egypt, he*ld established it as a statute for Joseph. I*pn heard an unknown voice say:
“I*pn removed the burden from their shoulders; their*ld hands were set free from the basket.
In*ln your distress you called and I rescued you, I*ld answered you out of a thundercloud; I*ld tested you at the waters of Meribah.
Hear*ln me, my people, and I will warn you— if*ld you would only listen to me, Israel!
You*ln shall have no foreign god among you; you*ld shall not worship any god other than me.
I*ln am the Lord*s your God, who*ld brought you up out of Egypt. Open*ln wide your mouth and I will fill it.
“But*pn my people would not listen to me; Israel*ld would not submit to me.
So*ln I gave them over to their stubborn hearts to*ld follow their own devices.
“If*pn my people would only listen to me, if*ld Israel would only follow my ways,
how*ln quickly I would subdue their enemies and*ld turn my hand against their foes!
Those*ln who hate the Lord*s would cringe before him, and*ld their punishment would last forever.
But*ln you would be fed with the finest of wheat; with*ld honey from the rock I would satisfy you.”
